name: Mixed Bag 33 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Average [C] | 10 Questions

questions.text: The Bureau of Indian Affairs is part of which department?
questions.explanation:
Interior.

	It is one of the oldest federal agencies. It was created in 1824 by the War Department and added to the Interior Department in 1849.

questions.text: A West Point cadet graduates with what rank?
questions.explanation:
Second Lieutenant.

	West Point is located in New York State on the banks of the Hudson River. Women were first allowed to attend in 1976.

questions.text: Which language is most commonly spoken in Brazil?
questions.explanation:
Portuguese.

	Portuguese is the official language of Brazil. Since 1938 it has been the compulsory language for teaching. English and French are secondary.

questions.text: What Republican ran against FDR in 1940?
questions.explanation:
Willkie.

	In 1932 he ran against Hoover, against Landon in 1936 and against Dewey in 1944.

questions.text: In what play do we find the line 'Goodnight goodnight, parting is such sweet sorrow'?
questions.explanation:
Romeo and Juliet.

	'Romeo and Juliet' was made into movies in 1936, 1954, 1966, 1968 and 1996.

questions.text: Anne Frank kept her diary while hiding with her family in what Dutch city?
questions.explanation:
Amsterdam.

	Amsterdam is the capital of the Netherlands.

questions.text: Long John Silver flew his Jolly Roger over what ship?
questions.explanation:
Hispaniola.

	Blackbeard had the ship The Queen Anne's Revenge, Captain Kidd had the Adventure Galley and Henry Hudson had the Half Moon.

questions.text: What do the Japanese call Japan?
questions.explanation:
Nippon.

	Koji-ki and Nihon Shoki are cronicles.

questions.text: What 1945 film starred Frank Sinatra and Gene Kelly in the Navy?
questions.explanation:
Anchors Aweigh.

	Frank was a sailor in 'On the Town', in the army in 'From Here To Eternity' and an assassin in 'Suddenly'.

questions.text: Seventh Avenue in New York City is associated with what business?
questions.explanation:
Fashion.

	Finance is associated with Wall Street, theater with Times Square and music with Tin Pan Alley. Tin Pan Alley was originally West 28th street between Broadway and 6th Avenue.
